perturbation.original_text: "ABOUT CUSTOMER" means any individual or entity who has registered with ebix either (i) through the registration process on the Insurance Center or (ii) registers with ebix after accessing the ebix Site from a link on the About Network.
perturbation.changed_text: "ABOUT CUSTOMER" means any individual or entity who has registered with ebix through the registration process on the Insurance Center. A user can also be considered as the registered customer if they are coming from About Network.
perturbation.explanation: Here the original text specifies two methods for a user to be considered an "About Customer". The modified text omits the second method, so it only includes the ones who directly registered to the site. This creates a contradiction about how a person is recognized as customer.

perturbation.original_text: 8. CREDIT 8.1 eBix shall receive all page view, impression, reach duration and frequency credit resulting from About Users accessing the Insurance Center.
perturbation.changed_text: 8. Credit 8.1 eBix shall receive page view credit resulting from About Patrons accessing the Insurance Center. All the additional credit will be decided later.
perturbation.explanation: The original text says that ebix gets credit based on multiple parameters when the user accesses the insurance center but the edited version states that it will only provide page view credit, and all additional credit will be decided later. This is a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: 15.1 Each party is an independent contractor and not an employee of the other party. Each party understands and agrees that (i) its employees are not entitled to any benefits provided to any employee of the other party and (ii) it is solely responsible for reporting as income any compensation received hereunder. Each party is responsible for compliance with all federal, state and local laws, regulations and orders in connection with taxes, unemployment insurance, social security, worker's compensation, disability or like matters.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.1 Each party may be perceived as an affiliate, but not an employee of the other party. Each party understands and agrees that (i) its workers are not entitled to all the benefits provided to any employee of the other party and (ii) it may not be solely responsible for reporting as income any compensation received hereunder. Each party may not be fully responsible for compliance with all federal, state and local laws, regulations and orders in connection with taxes, unemployment insurance, social security, worker's compensation, disability or like matters.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that each party is an 'independent contractor', it enforces that the parties are not employee of each other and they are responsible for all their expenses. The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by saying that 'each party may be perceived as an affiliate'. This created ambiguity.
